snippet: The colors of the New York City subway map have been described as a rainbow. Turns out, they could also be described as a grove.     The N, R, Q and W lines sport a shade called ''sunflower yellow.'' The Nos. 1, 2, and 3 trains use ''tomato red.''...
abstract: City Room blog on descriptive names assigned to shades of color in New York City subway map and signs; photo (M)

snippet: Appeals to raise money for AIDS are ubiquitous -- but the gap between what is needed and what is collected is enormous, and growing.     In February, Michel Sidibé, the executive director of Unaids, estimated that $27 billion would be needed this ...
abstract: Gap between donations needed for fight against AIDS and what is collected is enormous and growing; Unaids executive director Michael Sidibe has estimated that $27 billion is needed this year to fight disease, but total available, including what middle-income countries budget for themselves, has been estimated at $14 billion; photos; graph (M)

headline.main: As the Need Grows, the Money Runs Far Short
